website_summaries.verdict: A DOP-certified balsamic, aged up to 18 years. Comes in an 8.5 fl. oz. bottle.
pros: A thick consistency and rich taste make this a great substitute for more expensive options
cons: Some complain the vinegar is overly sweet

customer_reviews.title: What a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT traditional balsamic vinegar. It is either a reduced balsamic glaze or they've added sugar and thickeners. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: T. K. P.

customer_reviews.title: not that great if you know balsamic
customer_reviews.text: Honestly NOT good. This tastes like it was cut with sugar or other substance and thickening agent. Not at all impressed, not a great balsamic flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Manny Steiner

customer_reviews.title: Extremely thick, but bland
customer_reviews.text: This is nothing like real aged balsamic. I would have guessed that it was reduced, thickened, and sweetened balsamic vinegar, but it's just so bland. I should have known since it doesn't say "Aceto Balsamico Tradizionale" anywhere on the bottle, but the reviews seemed good. I hoped it would at least taste good, even if it wasn't real traditional aged balsamic. I was very wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Stoker

customer_reviews.title: or cooking store like sur la table
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, go buy a real aged balsamic from a reputable italian store, or cooking store like sur la table. You will know that this is not the real thing. I think they took cheaper balsamic and cooked it down to make it syrupy. The consistency is still not right though. Taste is not the same.
customer_reviews.author: millstheman

customer_reviews.title: This product is amazing! I've yet to taste a richer balsamic vinegar ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing! I've yet to taste a richer balsamic vinegar and being so close to Napa I've tried a lot. Because of its consistency being much thicker than other balsamics it transforms even the more simple meals I make. Last night I made homemade pizza with spinach and goat cheese then drizzled the balsamic on top. The MiaBella Balsamic Vinegar was just the touch I needed. I have and I will continue to recommend this to others you won't be disappointed. The only flaw is I wish it came in a bigger bottle :)
customer_reviews.author: Hillary Domecus

customer_reviews.title: You cannot return it!
customer_reviews.text: It does not taste good. I wish I could return it. But NO RETURNS. I recommend not buying this one. Some reviewers remarked on the lack of "credentials" on the bottle label. When I got it, I understood why. It basically has no label. It's just a blank bottle with the tag strung to it and the tag doesn't say much. Basically I got that it came from the country of Italy and that's it.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Eastwood

customer_reviews.title: Balsamic reduction is NOT balsamic vinager
customer_reviews.text: I bought this vinager as a a gift for my Italian boyfriend thinking this would be a great idea. WHAT A DISPOINTMENT!!! The vinagar was described as a balsamic vinegar but it’s actually a BELSAMIC REDUCTION not intended for dipping. It’s VERY sweet and over all a very bad experience. It’s a huge disappointment that the description doesn’t match the actual overrated product and there’s no way to return the product or contact thhe seller!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: This is not the real thing it’s not the traditional balsamic it’s just a balsamic vinegar.
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed this balsamic company is claiming it’s a traditional balsamic well it’s not there is no way it is as it does not have the certificate of authenticity from the Italian consortium. This is just an aged balsamic nothing more.
customer_reviews.author: J.F

customer_reviews.title: Love This Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff. I'm not a balsamic-vinegar snob, but I prefer to buy good-quality products that are better that what can be found in high-end supermarkets or expensive gourmet shops that really ought to stick with cookware. It is nicely syrupy, not too sweet, and a little goes a long way. I use it on fruit, roasted sweet peppers, and to finish off a saute of baby kale that I could eat all by myself, right from the pan. I could go on, but those are my favorites.
customer_reviews.author: unfulfilled wishes

customer_reviews.title: A Little Luxury...
customer_reviews.text: I've tried lots of "balsamic vinegars", both at home & in pricey Italian restaurants; many of these have been good, but not absolutely delicious. I decided to give MiaBella a try, & am glad I did. I like the rich fruit aroma & the marvelous flavor. MiaBella has a consistency similar to maple syrup; it doesn't slosh around on the plate. Hide the bottle! You don't want family members dumping this in a stew! (;-o Enjoy some MiaBella with olive oil, fresh-ground black pepper & some good bread... a simple luxury!
customer_reviews.author: Diadem

customer_reviews.title: I used it on ice cream one time and was surprised how good it tested
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I bought this balsamic vinegar. I used it on ice cream one time and was surprised how good it tested. Dipping my French bread in olive oil and the MiaBella balsamic vinegar is my favored evening snack with a glass of wine. I tried a different brand one time but this was a mistake. Love the thickness and rich flavor of this vinegar, it is just wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Quilter

customer_reviews.title: The Absolute Best Taste
customer_reviews.text: I have made 2 or 3 purchases of this balsamic vinegar so far and have never been disappointed in the taste. Everything I've incorporated this into has enhanced the finished product beyond my expectations. The only flaw comes with the new bottle. I really preferred the last bottle that had the cork. This one with the plastic insert wasn't (in my opinion) a good swap. I hope they go back to the older style bottle. Thanks again for an excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: T. Stenson

customer_reviews.title: RICH & CREAMY... DELICIOUS
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT PRODUCT!! Thick, rich, creamy and oh so tasty!! Has a savory-sweet taste. One of the best balsamic vinegars I've purchased. We mainly use this on authentic Greek salads (which does not have lettuce in it by the way!) and add a little Partanna olive oil. Mixed together they are great for bread dipping! No need to even add herbs. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Great at this price point.
customer_reviews.text: No it's not ultra fine Balsamico, but it is a worthy compromise between the very expensive real deal and the lower end impostors. I have been to Modena and brought back bottles of DOP, but they are so expensive I find myself not using them. This balsamico is perfect for putting that finishing touch on a dessert, salad, etc. every day and not worrying about it. It's a great bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.author: Palladio

customer_reviews.title: They changed recipe
customer_reviews.text: About 3 years ago this was a really great product. Then they changed the recipe. Instead of being actual aged vinegar, this is thickened through cooking and maybe even adulterated with sugar. They are surfing on their old good reputation, selling now selling cheap junk at premium price until the bran sinks. Do not buy under any circumstance.
customer_reviews.author: Olivier Gagnon

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this stuff
customer_reviews.text: If you think you've tasted balsamic vinegar, you haven't tasted anything unless you've had this stuff. It's absolutely delicious. I've been using it and organic, cold-pressed Braggs Olive oil on my salads exclusively for four months and I haven't gotten sick of it. I LOVE this stuff. I even brought samples into work and gave it to several friends who also loved it. Wonder if they ended up getting any. If they didn't they're missing out!
customer_reviews.author: Mandylyn

customer_reviews.title: Acrid
customer_reviews.text: This is not smooth. It is acidic and sticky. It should be syrupy and smooth. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: HMT

customer_reviews.title: A DELIGHTFUL SURPRISE THAT WILL TICKLE YOUR TASTEBUDS!
customer_reviews.text: This Balsamic Vinegar was, in my opinon, absolutely excellent! Smooth, creamy, thick and ever so tasty....these are just some of the words to describe it. Try it on fish and meats. Dribble some on salads and vegetables. I tried some on ice cream...sounds different but the taste is flavor enhancing and so delicious. I suggest that you dribble a few drops at a time and taste until you find the correct amount for you. It carries the taste that many would say is right up there with a Balsami Vinegar aged for 80 years while remaining very affordable. I have bought some for friends and family and they were delighted. Try it...I don't believe you will be dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: B. T. K.

customer_reviews.title: Great taste
customer_reviews.text: I'm updating my comment to say after reading some of the negative comments either I don't know any better because this product is our first. We liked it. There's a combination of both flavors of just the right amount of sweet and a hint of vinegar. It seems thick enough to us. My favorable rating remains.
customer_reviews.author: The Rsenal

customer_reviews.title: way too thick
customer_reviews.text: doesn't pour like vinegar. i know it's a good balsamic and i paid a lot but it is so hard to get out of the bottle. much too thick and then i have to use force and lose control over the flow. very disappointed to spend so much and not have what i expected.
customer_reviews.author: bartwin

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I must admit that I was very hesitant to spend so much on such a tiny bottle. I went with the other positive reviews and gave it a try. Needless to say I will be a return customer! I also invested in some high quality first cold press olive oil and made an oil/vinegar dip for some Italian 5 grain bread. It was better than any restaurant I have had. Very thick consistency, very sweet also. But delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Jankowski

customer_reviews.title: Quite good
customer_reviews.text: It has a great flavor. We are balsamic snobs with a high standard. We often get out vinegars from Vom Fass. That being said, this vinegar is incredibly thick. Thicker than I would have expected, which makes it slightly more difficult to drizzle. It is really good and certainly much better than you can get in any standard grocery store and even most specialty shops.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Thick and Great Taste
customer_reviews.text: Thick consistency. Great taste. It has an open mouth so be careful not to pour out too quickly, although it pours like real maple syrup so not a big problem. Wish their was a label to remind me of the brand, as I no longer wish to pour it with the tag hanging on it. Still a 5 star!! It's good!!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad I can now purchase this on Amazon.com!
customer_reviews.text: I had my first taste of MiaBella Balsamic Vinegar at my local farmers market in Mission Viejo, CA. The representative told me that their special blend comes all the way from Italy. I was quite impressed with the quality of their product. Their balsamic vinegar is not runny like the typical stuff you get from the store. It almost comes out in a thicker, syrup-like consistency. So a little of it goes a long way. I am most excited to find out that I can now buy it on Amazon, as I'm almost out of my first bottle!
customer_reviews.author: DTK

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is a thick, mellow, and slightly sweet balsamic vinegar. It has a lovely flavor, unlike some balsamic that have a bitter or slightly chemical taste. It’s especially good as a dip for strawberries.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Delicious Balsamic
customer_reviews.text: When we make baguettes or my favorite loaf-in-a-pot for when guests will be coming, we drizzle this stuff around the bread plates and provide Papa Vince's olive oil for dipping. It is a hit. Stuff is so good you want to lick the plate.
customer_reviews.author: PACoug

customer_reviews.title: ACETO AUTENTICO - Great in a Mortar & Pestle!
customer_reviews.text: When making a special dressing for a salad, Mirabella is a vinegar I often use. With a Balsamic so concentrated and intense, I prefer to use the 'mother of all kitchen tools'; the mortar and pestle. By pounding on the garlic and fresh herbs, you release the full intensity of their flavor profile. I don't know if this is true, but you will impress the hell out of your foodie friends, so they will believe you are serving a great salad dressing.
customer_reviews.author: D. Denton

customer_reviews.title: Balsamic to be savored...
customer_reviews.text: Thick, syrup like, delicious sweet/sour vinegar - you'll want to put it on everything - haha - but it's pricy, so savor it. Bottle smaller than I thought it would be from picture. It is 8.5 ounces so it's just a smudge over 1 cup.
customer_reviews.author: AmySchem

customer_reviews.title: It was his favorite gift! He cherishes it
customer_reviews.text: My son is an adventurous cook. We got him another bottle of balsamic vinegar for Christmas. It was his favorite gift! He cherishes it, and uses it sparingly. When he was in the Army in garrison at Fort Hood, he would have starved to death except for Taco Bell and ramen noodles. Now he'll look at a recipe and say, "Well, that's a good place to start. But if I did this....."
customer_reviews.author: Greymodel

customer_reviews.title: Not usable, not returnable
customer_reviews.text: Product came with contents oozing out of top wrapper, complete sticky mess. Tried to return or message supplier, but neither were an option. I then proceeded to open the bottle to see if it could be salvaged and found the contents so thick it would not pour out at all. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Juli Quinn

customer_reviews.title: It changed!
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying MiaBella vinegar for the last seven years and loved it. When I saw the sale I decided to stock up and bought 6 bottles. I noticed the new bottle design but didn't think much of it. Unfortunately, the bottle is not the only thing that changed... so has the taste! And they're not eligible for returns. Very disappointed and frustrated. What happened MiaBella?
customer_reviews.author: Kays487

customer_reviews.title: Not much flavor
customer_reviews.text: For the amount of money, I expected this to be fantastic. I knew it was a very small bottle because I read the amount of ounces, so per ounce very expensive. Which would be fine if it tastes good, Not a good flavor. Not much of a flavor at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda J.

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE! Won't come out of the bottle!!
customer_reviews.text: Looks like another recent person has had the same issue I had. Big mess, won't come out of the bottle at all, I can't use it and apparently now I can't return it. Going to speak to someone at Amazon about this. It's TOO expensive to not even be able to use it. Are they shipping bad batches out??? This stinks!
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Resendes

customer_reviews.title: Low acidity
customer_reviews.text: Low acidity so the sweetness is the dominant flavor. Makes bitter greens much more palatable.
customer_reviews.author: CastAway

customer_reviews.title: Love this! Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Buy it!!!! I have traveled all over and love to visit vinegar "boutiques" and I love purchasing these designer vinegars. With that said, during the school year we have not traveled much. I randomly found this vinegar on Amazon and gave it a try. It is equal if not above-average to others that we have purchased in Florida, California, and in Michigan. This will become a staple in our home. Thanks for sharing such a great product. Great drizzled on greens.
customer_reviews.author: Janine Reese

customer_reviews.title: Sweet
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I really wanted to like this and I can see how this would be popular with a culture that loves sweets. I like the acidity of balsamic. This is a sticky sweet balsamic with the viscosity of molasses. If you use it as a salad dressing, you don't need to add anything else. Because it's so thick, you can even draw patterns with it. However, it's sweet and very very thick. It's just not for me. I like an acidic balsamic that I can put with olive oil and garlic and dip sourdough bread into... this is like I added a bunch of sugar to the mixture and it's just not the right combination.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Best Balsamic Vinegar Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried lots of kinds of Balsamic Vinegar! This has the best taste of all! I use it in every salad I make with Italian Olive Oil.
customer_reviews.author: Marcy A. Prager

customer_reviews.title: Gotta have this
customer_reviews.text: This is a hidden gem. I love this on everything....sweet and savory. It is thicker than maple syrup and sooo full of flavor!
customer_reviews.author: Corinthian

customer_reviews.title: Great balsamic vinegar at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This balsamic vinegar is excellent. I took it to a potluck at work to use with some olive oil on top of salads and it got rave reviews. It is nice and thick with a nice sweet-ish vinegar taste. I look forward to using it for more things at home, especially for dipping bread. Overall, a great Balsamic Vinegar product (at least for what's easily available in the US) and at a pretty reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality
customer_reviews.text: Sweeter than run of the mill balsamic. For special occasions and condiment. May be wasted in a salad dressing unless just this and olive oil.
customer_reviews.author: Bugsy

customer_reviews.title: Finally found what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: After being in Italy and having the nice thick balsamic vinegar- I couldn’t go back to the watery stuff. Looked everywhere for the thick vinegar. Couldn’t even find it at a very popular well know local Italian market. I was so pleased to find what I was craving on Amazon! I just love it and use it on everything!
customer_reviews.author: Kimber H. Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Best Vinegar for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is the best balsamic vinegar I have ever had. I have not had many as expensive as this so I was hoping it would be great quality. It is much thicker and sweeter than your generic grocery store balsamic. I love using this on mozzarella and tomatoes for a great Caprese.
customer_reviews.author: H. Baumann

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly as described and reviewed. I still keep the "normal" or cheap or "not balsamic" vinegar that's much thinner for some uses but when making a fancy salad or dipping in bread at parties, I use this stuff. You also only need very little, unlike the fake vinegars out there. It'm very impressed with the product for the price, which I find to be very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Chocolate Strawberry Oasis pie recipe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for the aged balsamic vinegar in Jenna Hunterson's Chocolate Strawberry Oasis pie recipe ('The Waitress' movie). This added a an amazing flavor to the pie.
customer_reviews.author: Landscape Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Miabella the real deal at a decent price
customer_reviews.text: My wife and i have tried a variety of similarly priced balsamic vinegars and miabella is without doubt the best. The balsamic is very syrupy with a complexity of flavor from a bit earthy to sweet. After my purchase I received a nice hand written letter from the company thanking me for my purchase. My belief is that this company's attention to detail is apparent in the product they sell from the way the bottle looks to the rich flavor of the vinegar. I will buy this balsamic exclusively from here on out.
customer_reviews.author: phil upstate new york

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Can't vouch as too the authenticity of it, but it's flavor is great. It is both very sweet and complex. It could be a glaze as others say, but in the end it works well and tastes better than anything I've been able to find at speciality grocery stores. It makes a drool inducing salad with evoo.
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh, NC

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best balsamic vinegars I've ever had. It has the thick consistency and rich taste that all balsamics should have.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda Ruggles

customer_reviews.title: MiaBella The real deal of richness and sweetness
customer_reviews.text: I love the richness and sweetness of a great balsamic especially in salads or Caprese
customer_reviews.author: K. P

customer_reviews.title: Treacly goodness
customer_reviews.text: This vinegar is such a treat. It went into the homemade dressing that topped yesterday's Christmas salad of mesclun greens, Maytag bleu cheese, toasted walnuts, dried cranberries, and red onion. I also drizzled a tiny bit over the peach halves that I baked to accompany our traditional Christmas eve quiche. I will definitely repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Scribbler

customer_reviews.title: Thick, like syrup
customer_reviews.text: Sweet . Thick, like syrup. Tasty. It's pretty expensive for a small bottle; waaaaaayyyyy smaller than i thought it would be -- so am using this sparingly. Was great for capressi salad (tomato and mozzarella) .
customer_reviews.author: R BTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: A little drizzle goes a long way!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2017 and am now down to about an inch on the bottom of the bottle. I found that a little bit is better than more...otherwise it hits the back of throat hard. It is the best I have ever bought! Well worth the price. I will buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: SHAKA

customer_reviews.title: Taste is Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Balsamic Vinegar Very Rich and thick a little goes a long way!!!!! Taste is Fantastic, LOVE
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Awesome & Rich
customer_reviews.text: A recipe I tried called for balsamic vinegar; didn't know what that was. Google searched and learned quite a bit. Turned to Amazon to find a 'true' taste balsamic vinegar and was so very pleasantly surprised! I've used this on rice dishes, and a new recipe for garlic roasted cabbage steaks -- awesome! Recommending to my friends!
customer_reviews.author: Alaska rocks... again and still

customer_reviews.title: Thick sweet glaze / more like maple syrup
customer_reviews.text: This is balsamic GLAZE thick and sweet - I have bought this product before and it was the real this is not it :( this is a very thick sweet syrup
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: It's thick and sweet like what we discovered on our trip
customer_reviews.text: Our girls found this as a gift to us last year. Following a fabulous trip to Italy, we could not find comparable true balsamic vinegar. This is it ! It's thick and sweet like what we discovered on our trip. We liked it so much, we had to get another bottle. If you're looking for the real thing, get this. it's a bit pricy, but you use it sparingly. It was great with fresh summer tomatoes, fresh sweet basil, and soft mozzarella cheese, and a good EVOO for your own caprese salad.
customer_reviews.author: pharmrs

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for the table
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful bouquet, great flavors, very good consistency, nice bottle and cork. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: David Stockwell

customer_reviews.title: Nice, not great ----
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a top quality balsamic vinegar. Not as complex as others I have tasted and a little too thick for my taste. I diluted it with some of my other high-end balsamic and the result was extremely nice. Not great, nice. I find the price to be very accurate for what this is.
customer_reviews.author: NealOh

customer_reviews.title: Very thick balsamic vinegar
customer_reviews.text: Don’t look at the price!! This is the best balsamic vinegar I have ever tasted. Soooo thick. L
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Peterson

customer_reviews.title: The best you can get
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for the thickest, darkest and most intense balsamic vinegar, this is it. I have tried them all and particularly I can say that if you take a very big smell, it doesnt make your nose burn. That is the best example I can give from the 4-5 I have tried in the $40-50 range.
customer_reviews.author: BLM

customer_reviews.title: A bit pricey but you wont be sorry
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best balsamic vinegar I have bought online and I have bought several others. The ones at the grocery stores simply do not compare with the quality and taste. It's great on everything that needs a little more flavor. I wont be buying any more salad dressing while I have this on hand.
customer_reviews.author: ValinTempe

customer_reviews.title: ... balsamic vinegars on Amazon and this is clearly the best for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have bought all the high end balsamic vinegars on Amazon and this is clearly the best for the money. You won't be disappointed in your purchase. The flavor is superb and I am a frequent flyer on this product.
customer_reviews.author: donald g

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but WORTH IT.
customer_reviews.text: This is amazingly tasteful. It's worth the extra money. It's sweet, thick, awesome.
customer_reviews.author: happy in tn

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent flavor. Price per ounce makes one choose when to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary T Bundy

customer_reviews.title: Flavor is o.k.
customer_reviews.text: Product is very thick, like a reduction; but it is not particularly flavorful.
customer_reviews.author: dutchkirk

customer_reviews.title: You have to partake to appreciate
customer_reviews.text: What an experience. The most beautiful taste that I ever had and will definitely be a staple in or kitchen from now on. Added to extra virgin olive oil and then dipped into with a fine Italian bread - out of this world!!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph W. Hanlon

customer_reviews.title: I love good balsamic vinegar and have tried many brands
customer_reviews.text: I love good balsamic vinegar and have tried many brands. I bought this to use as a salad vinegar but once I tasted it i'm saving this for fruits, icecreams and cheeses. I can say with confidence that this is the best value on the market. The taste is up there with the very best.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Bowma Jr.

customer_reviews.title: I was not disappointed. This is used more as a condiment than ...
customer_reviews.text: I've always had the grocery story very thinned out balsamic vinegar and have been looking for the authentic syrup. I was not disappointed. This is used more as a condiment than an ingredient and it is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No amount of reduction on a typical store brand of balsamic could ever taste like this. And luckily a little goes a long ...
customer_reviews.text: REAL Balsamic Vinegar. Thick, rich, and balanced. Aged balsamic is the only way to truly experience it. I have been looking for this quality for a while now. No amount of reduction on a typical store brand of balsamic could ever taste like this. And luckily a little goes a long way- I will use this on salads, meats, breads, cheese, fruit and even on ice cream with berries.
customer_reviews.author: V.V.

customer_reviews.title: Taste Great and Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Second time ordering this nice bottle of balsamic vinegar. We tried different bottle of balsamic vinegar and still missed this one, so ordering it again. It has nice depth of flavor. The customer service was excellent in answering my questions/requests. Will def be a long term customer.
customer_reviews.author: Christina H. Young

customer_reviews.title: Best flavor
customer_reviews.text: I've never found a better flavor than this balsamic vinegar. Its thick, sweet. Perfect flavoring for any extra special dish . This is not an everyday balsamic. Its a treat to be savored.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great flavoring.
customer_reviews.text: I use this vinegar in maple-balsamic vinaigrette and when sauteing spinach or swiss chard. Very good!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Rathburn

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Delicious
customer_reviews.text: This is just like the 25 year aged balsamic we had in Italy.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: One of the better balsamic I have had
customer_reviews.text: One of the better balsamic I have had. It doesn't contain red vinegar or any other vinegar that gives it that terrible tang. This one is perfect! We use it for dips and salad dressings
customer_reviews.author: Satucker

customer_reviews.title: Delish
customer_reviews.text: Will order again. So much better than what you can get in local stores.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Ayers

customer_reviews.title: Delizioso!!
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly delicious. Thick, sweet, perfection. For those who have never invested in a good bottle of balsamic vinegar, the difference is indescribable. You will never go back to that thin, store-bought stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Shar

customer_reviews.title: Nice thick good quality balsamic.  Delicious
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality, nice and thick balsamic, straight out of the bottle delish. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Indulge and Win
customer_reviews.text: Mibella Balsamic Vinegar is heavenly. I use it as a salad dressing. It is sweet and delicious and I feel pampered using it. And it is low in calories. Win Win Win
customer_reviews.author: Margaret A. Herron

customer_reviews.title: It's a great indulgence. The taste is sweet
customer_reviews.text: Pricey but delicious. It's a great indulgence. The taste is sweet, sour, smooth, and perfect on fruit.
customer_reviews.author: scottjb

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this balsamic! I’ve purchased this many times and I’ve never been disappointed. In the description it mentions putting it on vanilla ice cream, so I tried and loved it! Plus this was the perfect gift for my mother in law.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: While there are many Balsamic Vinegars on the market. ...
customer_reviews.text: While there are many Balsamic Vinegars on the market. While searching on Amazon for top olive oils and found oil used by Mario Batalli- I also found this vinegar-- Ordered the combo-- excellent- and will be ordering more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: L.Walter

customer_reviews.title: Giving a wished for present
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a wished for gift for our daughter-in-law. Apparently she knows this particular brand of balsamic vinegar very well so we are happy to add this to her cupboards.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Delicious Balsamic!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Balsamic! I buy it for my daughters every Christmas. We feel it is Amazingly Delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: My New Favorite Balsamic Vinegar
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended that I try this balsamic vinegar. Now it is my new favorite balsamic. It is good on everything that I have tried. I love it for caprese salad! My favorite thing about MiaBella is the thickness of it. It actually stays on the salad and vegetables instead of running to the bottom of the bowl. A little goes a long way. The taste is flavorful and the bottle make a great accent piece for the kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Mary in Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Balsamic!
customer_reviews.text: A thick, rich, sweet balsamic with a hint of the acidity after the sweet . . . recommend for a definite treat. This would not be used in cooking (who would want to waste any via cooking), but drizzled after cooking or over fruit/dessert to enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: kaymey

customer_reviews.title: Best Modena I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: Best Modena I have ever had! It is pure pleasure to have this product in my kitchen. Full bodied yet smooth. Incredible flavor Pure joy to cook with and taste.
customer_reviews.author: I lv bluray

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best.
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny...thick and rich not like the “Modena” balsamic vinegar you get in a grocery store.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Benst

customer_reviews.title: Fresh figs and tomatoes appetizers enhanced with MiaBella
customer_reviews.text: Our home-grown mission figs and tomatoes are ripe and abundant. We have been trying several different appetizers using MiaBella Balsamic Vinegar and they are always a hit. The consistency and taste are wonderful and rich. It is finger licking good.
customer_reviews.author: JSanders

customer_reviews.title: Mild Flavoring
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to find a product with a deep woodsy balsamic flavoring, this one is much too mild for my taste buds
customer_reviews.author: KonaGal

customer_reviews.title: Delicious
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in a pinch with 2 day prime. The product exceeded my expectations. It was very thick and rich. It went beautifully with the cheese plate that I created and I have used it multiple times over caprese and other salads, or just to dip bread into.
customer_reviews.author: therealaz

customer_reviews.title: Best Balsamic
customer_reviews.text: Very well developed taste. One of the best I’ve tried.
customer_reviews.author: azdick

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly good balsamic!
customer_reviews.text: This balsamic is amazing. So much better than the stuff you get at the grocery store. Richer and more depth of flavor. So good on strawberries, for dipping crusty bread, or drizzled over a salad. YUM!! So worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the money. Outstanding for reduction sauces, especially great on lamb chops. It is always in our pantry.
customer_reviews.author: JADroste0215

customer_reviews.title: Tastes amazing, only ever had store bought before
customer_reviews.text: Tastes amazing, only ever had store bought before. Read other reviews gave a try, won't be able to go back to the store stuff now. Thick and sweet wonderful stuff. Definitely worth trying.
customer_reviews.author: G. S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is very delicious and I use it alone on salad and fruit. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: Delish!!
customer_reviews.text: This balsamic is excellent, mild sweet taste but still has that balsamic acid flavor. I just pour a bit over my fresh grown tomatoes and it was excellent, no oil needed. Best balsamic I have ever tasted.
customer_reviews.author: Jean M

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful flavor.
customer_reviews.text: Pours likes molasses and a little goes a long way. Wonderful flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Donna C. Muse

customer_reviews.title: Best balsamic I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: First of all I don't consider myself a foodie but I love sharing good food with family and friends. After trying this balsamic from an event in Phoenix, AZ I was shocked how much I enjoyed something so simple. Its balsamic vinegar but nothing I've had before. The consistency coated the spoon and the flavor was delicious. Anyone looking to add a high quality tradtional balsamic vinegar to their kitchen should seriously consider MiaBella.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Bush

customer_reviews.title: Delicious balsamic
customer_reviews.text: A thick, sweet delicious balsamic to add as a garnish. A little goes a long way! I got 2 yesrs out of mine and it never lost its taste.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: I think this is very good.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES COMBINE WITH A GOOD FETA AND FRESH CUCUMBER OR OLIVES! You might get run over by fellow employees trying to procure some more to "give to someone else" or "take home"........ None of it left the building.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Kat

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband because he is a Balsamic Vinegar snob. Really. He tried it and loved it! Win for the wife!
customer_reviews.author: kleforge

product_meta.title: MiaBella Balsamic Vinegar
feature_bullets: PRODUCT OF ITALY: Aged Italian balsamic vinegar certified produced in and protected by the Modena Region.
VERSATILE IN THE KITCHEN: Tastes great on meat, cheese, fish, salads, strawberries, or even vanilla ice cream.
UNIQUE AND SMALL BATCH: The perfect gift a foodie or a chef in your life. Impress your friends and family.
HIGHEST QUALITY: Made with 100% grape must and certified organic agriculture. No added caramels, flavors, or preservatives.
